segments.text: I'm just standing here, utterly perplexed by the scene before me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can so many things be going wrong all at once in one kitchen?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The most striking thing is the woman, so calm, so focused on her plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's like a statue, completely impervious to the literal flood at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's truly unbelievable that she hasn't looked down or heard the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sight of the overflowing sink is just bizarrely hypnotic in its constancy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And then, of course, the children are adding another layer of silent drama.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A boy on a stool, reaching for cookies from an open cabinet, what a sight!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way that stool is tilted makes me gasp; it looks ready to topple any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His little accomplice, the girl, is waiting with such eager anticipation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a perfectly choreographed act of domestic chaos and childhood daring.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The fact that none of them are acknowledging the others' predicaments is astounding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: You almost expect someone to break character and react, but they don't.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole situation feels like a surreal painting come to life.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm just genuinely surprised at the sheer amount of unnoticed activity.
segments.speaker: PAR
